title: S Phase
description: DNA synthesis occurs in the S phase, or the synthesis phase, of the cell cycle. The cell duplicates its hereditary material, and two copies of the chromosome are formed. As DNA replication continues, the E type cyclins shared by the G1 and S phases, are destroyed and the levels of the mitotic cyclins rise.  View original pathway at [http://www.reactome.org/PathwayBrowser/#DIAGRAM=69242 Reactome].
